phasepy basicsÂ¶

In order to start with phase equilibrium calculations it is necessary to provided pure component and mixture info. Phasepy is an object oriented python package that implements two basics classes for this purpose.

  • phasepy.component
  • phasepy.mixture

With the class component phasepy.component, pure component info is saved, this includes critical temperature, pressure, volume, acentric factor, antoine coefficients and group contribution info. On the other hand, classs phasepy.mixture saves pure component data and also allows to incorporate interactions parameters for the available models as, NRTL, Wilson, Redlich Kister.

>>> from phasepy import component
>>> water = component(name = 'water', Tc = 647.13, Pc = 220.55, Zc = 0.229, Vc = 55.948, w = 0.344861,
...        Ant =  [  11.64785144, 3797.41566067,  -46.77830444],
...        GC = {'H2O':1})
>>> ethanol = component(name = 'ethanol', Tc = 514.0, Pc = 61.37, Zc = 0.241, Vc = 168.0, w = 0.643558,
...        Ant = [  11.61809279, 3423.0259436 ,  -56.48094263],
...        GC = {'CH3':1, 'CH2':1,'OH(P)':1})
>>> water.psat(T = 373)
1.0072796747419537
>>> water.vlrackett(T = 310)
16.46025809309672
>>> ethanol.psat(T = 373)
2.233335305328437
>>> ethanol.vlrackett(T = 310)
56.32856995891473

Now, from two components a mixture can be created:

>>> from phasepy import mixture
>>> mix = mixture(ethanol, water)
>>> mix.names
['ethanol', 'water']
>>> mix.nc
2
>>> mix.psat(T = 373)
array([2.23333531, 1.00727967])
>>> mix.vlrackett(T = 310)
array([56.32856996, 16.46025809])
